intro: Julocroton montevidensis var. lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate julocroton, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and parts of Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
